alma-notices.title: PO number not in PO Line Cancellation notice

comments.body:
To confirm:
config > General > letters > PO Line cancellation letter > Letter Examples Tab > POLineCancellationLetter - 09/20/2021 13:21:34 EDT

Hi
 
Here are the messages which need to be associated with the Loan Status Notice letter. Mark opened a ticket (#175) for updating the behavior so that recall messages do not continue to go out to patrons with extended due dates. It’s very confusing and it’s a customer service issue at this point. I’d appreciate it if this could be updated soon.
 
The subject of the notice letter should be “Recall or other due date change”.
 
I marked several NA (#3,4,6)  because we don’t intend to use those. We do want to instead use #2 when a recall is cancelled. I assume that can be set up in our configuration if it isn’t already.
 
1.message (the message for when the due date is changed without a recall):
The library has changed the due date of your borrowed item. See details below for the new due date.
2.cancel_recall_date_change (for when a due date is reverted due to a recall being cancelled):
The recall that was placed on your borrowed item has been cancelled, and the original due date has been restored. See details below for the due date.
3.NA: cancel_recall_renew (for when a recall is cancelled and the loan to the original patron is renewed):
The recall that was placed on your borrowed item has been cancelled. The loan has been renewed. See details below for the due date.
4.NA: cancel_recall_no_date_change (for when a recall is cancelled but you don't change the shortened due date):
The recall that was placed on your borrowed item has been cancelled. There is no change in its due date
5.recall_and_date_change (for when a recall shortens a due date):
The following item, currently loaned to you, has been recalled for course reserve or another borrower. Please return it by the new due date to avoid recall fines. 
6.NA: recall_and_no_date_change (for when a recall does not modify the due date, likely not used):
Your borrowed item has been recalled. There is no change in its due date.
 
Thank you,
Joan

comments.body:
Currently, there is the following disparity between the `dev` and `staging` environments:

```bash
Sep 21, 2021 10:06:58 AM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngine startInternal
INFO: Starting Servlet Engine: Apache Tomcat/7.0.104
Sep 21, 2021 10:06:58 AM org.apache.catalina.startup.HostConfig deployDescriptor
INFO: Deploying deployment descriptor [/home/dspace/apache-tomcat-7.0.104/conf/Catalina/localhost/rt4ds.xml]
```

```bash
Sep 21, 2021 10:16:14 AM org.apache.catalina.startup.HostConfig deployDirectory
INFO: Deploying web application directory [/mnt/disks/oarstagingdatastore/prod-copy/dspace/webapps/rt4ds]
Sep 21, 2021 10:16:14 AM org.apache.catalina.startup.HostConfig deployDirectory
INFO: Deployment of web application directory [/mnt/disks/oarstagingdatastore/prod-copy/dspace/webapps/rt4ds] has finished in [70] ms
```

...where `/home/dspace/apache-tomcat-7.0.104/conf/Catalina/localhost/rt4ds.xml` is located only on the `dev` environment server, and may need to be added to https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible

Manually adding this file with the following contents restored access to `rt4ds` for the `staging` environment:

```xml
<Context docBase="/home/dspace/dspace/webapps.static/rt4ds" path="/rt4ds">
</Context>
```

While https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/tree/oar-rt4ds-deployment-jrgriffiniii advances this, while testing the provisioning on the `dev` environment resulted in a number of errors, resulting in the need to address the following:

```bash
pulsys@gcp-oar-dev1:~$ sudo chown -R dspace:dspace /home/dspace/scripts/.aliases
pulsys@gcp-oar-dev1:~$ sudo chown -R dspace:dspace /home/dspace/scripts/.aliases.local
[...]
dspace@gcp-oar-dev1:~$ ls -lta /etc
total 920
drw-r--r--   8 dspace dspace  4096 Sep 21 13:14 hosting
[...]
pulsys@gcp-oar-dev1:~$ sudo chmod 755 /etc/hosting
```
https://git.atmire.com/clients/princeton-5/-/tree/jrgriffiniii-oar-lisd-form-updates-test tracks the changes for the Google Form bugs and links
https://git.atmire.com/clients/princeton-5/-/merge_requests/46 advances the rebuild for the OAR code base with rt4ds.

figgy.title: Fixes TwoUp labeling in Order Manager
Automatic pagination for two up images not funtioning in figgy order manager

comments.body:
Thanks for testing @kelea99 , I'm dropping your video here as validation: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rkwA2JVEhh5q_jLgM7r3ak41KlN7YJj6/view?usp=sharing_eil_m&ts=6149fae0

I think the bracket feature works, but it only brackets the left or right and you have to select it afterwards. If this is not what's intended, let's open a new ticket.

I know there are some instances (rare) that have all the pages bracketed, but it has only ever been for one up pagination of some special collections item(s) and the bracketing works fine there. I do not know of any use cases with two up bracketing for the entire volume/item.

comments.body: These updated mappings look good to me @hectorcorrea, I think one of the failing tests related to the hathiurl can be removed since we deprecated ETAS.

@kevinreiss Thanks for the feedback. I had to update one of the fixtures to include the new Alma library/holding codes (instead of Voyager codes) but that caused a bunch of other tests (unrelated to Stackmap but that use the location codes) to break. Hunting them down and tracing what the equivalent Alma code should be took me a bit longer than I thought but I think this is finally ready.

Used [browsertrix-crawler](https://github.com/webrecorder/browsertrix-crawler) to do a test crawl of the derridas margins site from my laptop. It ran for ~ 4 hours (fwiw I was also using the laptop for other things during this time).

Here's how I ran it and the output I got:

```
% docker run -v $PWD/crawls:/crawls/ -it webrecorder/browsertrix-crawler crawl --url https://derridas-margins.princeton.edu/ --generateWACZ --text --collection derridasmargins-test
Text Extraction: Enabled
Load timeout for https://derridas-margins.princeton.edu/library/husserl-der-ursprung-der-geometrie-als-intentional-historisches-problem-1962-B/gallery/p-220-inside-back-cover-insertion-a-recto/ TimeoutError: Navigation timeout of 90000 ms exceeded
    at /app/node_modules/puppeteer-core/lib/cjs/puppeteer/common/LifecycleWatcher.js:106:111
Load timeout for https://derridas-margins.princeton.edu/interventions/?annotation_type=line&page=11 TimeoutError: Navigation timeout of 90000 ms exceeded
    at /app/node_modules/puppeteer-core/lib/cjs/puppeteer/common/LifecycleWatcher.js:106:111
Load timeout for https://derridas-margins.princeton.edu/interventions/?annotation_type=marginal+mark&page=30 TimeoutError: Navigation timeout of 90000 ms exceeded
    at /app/node_modules/puppeteer-core/lib/cjs/puppeteer/common/LifecycleWatcher.js:106:111
Load timeout for https://derridas-margins.princeton.edu/interventions/?page=16&annotation_type=underlining TimeoutError: Navigation timeout of 90000 ms exceeded
    at /app/node_modules/puppeteer-core/lib/cjs/puppeteer/common/LifecycleWatcher.js:106:111
Load timeout for https://derridas-margins.princeton.edu/references/?page=54 TimeoutError: Navigation timeout of 90000 ms exceeded
    at /app/node_modules/puppeteer-core/lib/cjs/puppeteer/common/LifecycleWatcher.js:106:111
Load timeout for https://derridas-margins.princeton.edu/interventions/?page=33&annotation_type=line TimeoutError: Navigation timeout of 90000 ms exceeded
    at /app/node_modules/puppeteer-core/lib/cjs/puppeteer/common/LifecycleWatcher.js:106:111
Load timeout for https://derridas-margins.princeton.edu/references/?page=33 TimeoutError: Navigation timeout of 90000 ms exceeded
    at /app/node_modules/puppeteer-core/lib/cjs/puppeteer/common/LifecycleWatcher.js:106:111
Load timeout for https://derridas-margins.princeton.edu/interventions/?page=51 TimeoutError: Navigation timeout of 90000 ms exceeded
    at /app/node_modules/puppeteer-core/lib/cjs/puppeteer/common/LifecycleWatcher.js:106:111

== Start:     2021-09-21 16:31:33.659
== Now:       2021-09-21 20:27:55.506 (running for 3.9 hours)
== Progress:  2868 / 2868 (100.00%), errors: 1 (0.03%)
== Remaining: 0.0 ms (@ 0.20 pages/second)
== Sys. load: 37.0% CPU / 79.7% memory
== Workers:   1
   #0 IDLE
Waiting to ensure pending data is written to WARCs...
Generating WACZ
Validating passed pages.jsonl file
Reading and Indexing All WARCs
Writing archives...
Generating page index from passed pages...
Header detected in the passed pages.jsonl file
Generating datapackage.json
Generating datapackage-digest.json
```

Here are the sizes of the `.warc.gz` files that were generated:
```
% ls -l crawls/collections/derridasmargins-test/archive/
total 1657512
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff   67718672 Sep 21 16:25 rec-20210921163135141911-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff   86732864 Sep 21 16:27 rec-20210921163135316862-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff   49708883 Sep 21 16:23 rec-20210921163135356001-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff  103751541 Sep 21 16:25 rec-20210921163135484484-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff  138867254 Sep 21 16:27 rec-20210921163135498226-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff  121607803 Sep 21 16:27 rec-20210921163135546143-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff  145825162 Sep 21 16:27 rec-20210921163135567093-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff   59891655 Sep 21 16:19 rec-20210921163136049692-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
```
or same in human readable sizes:
```
% ls -lh crawls/collections/derridasmargins-test/archive/
total 1657512
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff    65M Sep 21 16:25 rec-20210921163135141911-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff    83M Sep 21 16:27 rec-20210921163135316862-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff    47M Sep 21 16:23 rec-20210921163135356001-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff    99M Sep 21 16:25 rec-20210921163135484484-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff   132M Sep 21 16:27 rec-20210921163135498226-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff   116M Sep 21 16:27 rec-20210921163135546143-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff   139M Sep 21 16:27 rec-20210921163135567093-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
-rw-r--r--  1 rkoeser  staff    57M Sep 21 16:19 rec-20210921163136049692-23b1f8eb3af7.warc.gz
```

looks like the entire collection comes to ~ 1.5GB:
```
% du -sh crawls/collections/derridasmargins-test/
1.5G	crawls/collections/derridasmargins-test/
```

but based on this output I think the wacz file may be duplicating the content in the archive warc.gz files:
```
% du -sh crawls/collections/derridasmargins-test/*
809M	crawls/collections/derridasmargins-test/archive
752M	crawls/collections/derridasmargins-test/derridasmargins-test.wacz
  0B	crawls/collections/derridasmargins-test/indexes
7.1M	crawls/collections/derridasmargins-test/pages
  0B	crawls/collections/derridasmargins-test/static
  0B	crawls/collections/derridasmargins-test/templates
```

I haven't investigated yet what urls are included or tried to play the archive back with pywb — if this includes IIIF image urls that we'll be able to exclude then the final archive will be smaller. (Although if there's any missing content then vice versa)

pulfalight.title: DAO with incorrectly formatted link raises exception
